intro: Stemonurus ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaf stemonurus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
